Remarks: Lake area increased between 06/10/2009 and 07/12/2009 and water discharged before 08/04/2009. By 07/28/2009 the peak lake volume before flood 18.35x106 m3 with a lake area 1.08km2.  Peak discharge as Kaqun 1470 m3/s

Lake developed in winter 2014 and expanded to 07/04/2015. By 07/04/2015 the peak lake volume before flood 9.83x106 m3 with a lake area 0.65km2. By 07/15/2015 the outburst flood volume reached 51.1 9.83x106 m3 (Round et al. 2017). The lake reformed during winter 2015

Lake area increased between 06/04/2016 and 06/20/2016 and outburst occurred before 07/30/2016. By 07/14/2016 the peak volume before flood 43.89x106 m3 with a lake area 1.73km2. Round et al. (2017) reported rapid drainage on 07/17/2016. Peak outburst volume 42.3 x106 m3
Flood occurred on 08/11/2016 (Round et al., 2017), while by July 30, 2016 the peak volume before flood 13.32 x 106 m3 with a lake area 0.98km2 . The lake reformed by December 2016
Lake area increased to peak 08/10/2017 and outburst between 08/10/2017 and 08/26/2017. The peak volume before flood 114.99x106 m3 with a lake area 2.93km2. This is the second biggest lake since 2000

Since the partial drainage by GLOF in 2017 the lake persisted through the winter and in the spring of 2018 the lake expanded with a peak volume by August 08, 2018 of 85.98 x 106 m3 with a lake area 2.38km2.

Strachey (1853) reported that the oldest flood occurred in ~1780 in the upper Shyok valley due to the bursting of Kumdan glacier lake. His conclusion was based on interview with eighty years old resident of the Shyok valley.

Two Kumdan glaciers generated obstacles in the upper Shyok valley during June of 1835. The height of ice dam made by an upper glacier (possibly Chong Kumdan) was 700 vertical feet, above the valley bottom and a large lake accumulated between Kumdan and Gyapahan.  The sudden burst of lake resulted in a large discharge downstream. Maximum devastation occurred in Lagzhung village (mid Nubra) and Chorbat (Balti).
On 11th December 2012 a community exchange documented this event. A huge damage occurred to natural forest as well as the settlements of village Taisote and Massingot.
On 11th December 2012 a community exchange documented this event. Hinarchi Glacier burst resulting complete damage to natural forest and agriculture land of villages Bulchi and Chira.
